 1328: external_editor_unicode(Config) ->
 1329:     NanoPath = os:find_executable("nano"),
 1330:     case NanoPath of
 1331:         false -> {skip, "nano is not installed"};
 1332:         _ ->
 1333:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1334:             try
 1335:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1336:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1337:                 send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1338:                 check_content(Term,"3> " ++ hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1339:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% open external editor (nano)
 1340:                 check_content(Term,"GNU nano [\\d.]+"),
 1341:                 send_tty(Term, "still "),
 1342:                 check_content(Term,"\nstill "),
 1343:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% save in nano
 1344:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1345:                 send_tty(Term, "C-X"), %% quit in nano
 1346:                 check_content(Term,"still "++hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1347:                 ok
 1348:             after
 1349:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1350:                 ok
 1351:             end
 1352:     end.
 1353: 
 1354: %% There used to be a race condition when using shell:start_interactive where
 1355: %% the newline handling of standard_error did not change correctly to compensate
 1356: %% for the tty changing to canonical mode
 1357: shell_standard_error_nlcr(Config) ->
 1358: 
 1359:     [
 1360:      begin
 1361:          Term = setup_tty([{env,[{"TERM",TERM}]},{args, ["-noshell"]} | Config]),
 1362:          try
 1363:              rpc(Term, io, format, [standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", []]),
 1364:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest$"),
 1365:              rpc(Term, fun() -> shell:start_interactive(),
 1366:                                 io:format(standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", [])
 1367:                        end),
 1368:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest(\n|.)*test\ntest\ntest")
 1369:          after
 1370:              stop_tty(Term)
 1371:          end
 1372:      end || TERM <- ["dumb",os:getenv("TERM")]].
 1373: 
 1374: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1375: shell_suspend(Config) ->
 1376: 
 1377:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1378:     %% In order to suspend `erl` we need it to run in a shell that has job control
 1379:     %% so we start the peer within a tmux window instead of having it be the original
 1380:     %% process.
 1381:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1382: 
 1383:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1384:               post_process_args =>
 1385:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1386:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs =
 1387:                                       lists:join(
 1388:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1389:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1390:                         end
 1391:             },
 1392: 
 1393: 
 1394:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1395: 
 1396:     try
 1397:         send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1398:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1399:         send_tty(Term, "C-Z"),
 1400:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1401:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1402:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1403:         send_tty(Term, "M-l"),
 1404:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1405:         check_location(Term,{0,width(hard_unicode())}),
 1406:         ok
 1407:     after
 1408:         stop_tty(Term),
 1409:         ok
 1410:     end.
 1411: 
 1412: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1413: shell_full_queue(Config) ->
 1414: 
 1415:     [throw({skip,"Need unbuffered to run"}) || os:find_executable("unbuffered") =:= false],
 1416: 
 1417:     %% In order to fill the read buffer of the terminal we need to get a
 1418:     %% bit creative. We first need to start erl in bash in order to be
 1419:     %% able to get access to job control for suspended processes.
 1420:     %% We then also wrap `erl` in `unbuffer -p` so that we can suspend
 1421:     %% that program in order to block writing to stdout for a while.
 1422: 
 1423:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1424:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1425: 
 1426:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1427:               post_process_args =>
 1428:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1429:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs = ["unbuffer -p "] ++
 1430:                                       lists:join(
 1431:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1432:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1433:                         end
 1434:             },
 1435: 
 1436: 
 1437:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1438: 
 1439:     UnbufferedPid = os:cmd("ps -o ppid= -p " ++ rpc(Term,os,getpid,[])),
 1440: 
 1441:     WriteUntilStopped =
 1442:         fun F(Char) ->
 1443:                 rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char],[]]),
 1444:                 put(bytes,get(bytes,0)+1),
 1445:                 receive
 1446:                     stop ->
 1447:                         rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char+1],[]])
 1448:                 after 0 -> F(Char)
 1449:                 end
 1450:         end,
 1451: 
 1452:     WaitUntilBlocked =
 1453:         fun(Pid, Ref) ->
 1454:                 (fun F(Cnt) ->
 1455:                          receive
 1456:                              {'DOWN',Ref,_,_,_} = Down ->
 1457:                                  ct:fail({io_format_did_not_block, Down})
 1458:                          after 1000 ->
 1459:                                  ok
 1460:                          end,
 1461:                          case process_info(Pid,dictionary) of
 1462:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,Cnt}]} ->
 1463:                                  ct:log("Bytes until blocked: ~p~n",[Cnt]),
 1464:                                  %% Add one extra byte as for
 1465:                                  %% the current blocking call
 1466:                                  Cnt + 1;
 1467:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,NewCnt}]} ->
 1468:                                  F(NewCnt)
 1469:                          end
 1470:                  end)(0)
 1471:         end,
 1472: 
 1473:     try
 1474:         %% First test that we can suspend and then resume
 1475:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid),
 1476:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1477:         {Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($a) end),
 1478:         WaitUntilBlocked(Pid, Ref),
 1479:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1480:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1481:         Pid ! stop,
 1482:         check_content(Term,"b$"),
 1483: 
 1484:         send_tty(Term, "."),
 1485:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1486: 
 1487:         %% Then we test that all characters are written when system
 1488:         %% is terminated just after writing
 1489:         {ok,Cols} = rpc(Term,io,columns,[user]),
 1490:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1491:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid),
 1492:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1493:         {Pid2, Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($c) end),
 1494:         Bytes = WaitUntilBlocked(Pid2, Ref2) - 1,
 1495:         stop_tty(Term),
 1496:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1497:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1498:         check_content(
 1499:           fun() ->
 1500:                   tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term)])
 1501:           end, lists:flatten([lists:duplicate(Cols,$c) ++ "\n" ||
 1502:                                  _ <- lists:seq(1,(Bytes) div Cols)]
 1503:                              ++ [lists:duplicate((Bytes) rem Cols,$c)])),
 1504:         ct:log("~ts",[tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term)])]),
 1505:         ok
 1506:     after
 1507:         stop_tty(Term),
 1508:         ok
 1509:     end.
 1510: 
 1511: get(Key,Default) ->
 1512:     case get(Key) of
 1513:         undefined ->
 1514:             Default;
 1515:         Value ->
 1516:             Value
 1517:     end.
 1518: 
 1519: %% A list of unicode graphemes that are notoriously hard to render
 1520: hard_unicode() ->
 1521:     ZWJ =
 1522:         case os:type() of
 1523:             %% macOS has very good rendering of ZWJ,
 1524:             %% but the cursor does not agree with it..
 1525:             {unix, darwin} -> [];
 1526:             _ -> [[16#1F91A,16#1F3FC]]    % Hand with skintone 
 1527:         end,
 1528:     [[16#1f600],             % Smilie 
 1529:     "",                   % Hangul
 1530:     "Z","a","l","g","o" %% Vertically stacked chars
 1531:      %%"",            % Zero width joiner
 1532:      %%""                % Zero width joiner
 1533:      | ZWJ].
 1534: 
 1535: hard_unicode_match(Config) ->
 1536:     ["\\Q",[unicode_to_octet(Config, U) || U <- hard_unicode()],"\\E"].
 1537: 
 1538: unicode_to_octet(Config, U) ->
 1539:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1540:         unicode -> U;
 1541:         latin1 -> unicode_to_octet(U)
 1542:     end.
 1543: 
 1544: unicode_to_octet(U) ->
 1545:     [if Byte >= 128 -> [$\\,integer_to_list(Byte,8)];
 1546:         true -> Byte
 1547:      end || <<Byte>> <= unicode:characters_to_binary(U)].
 1548: 
 1549: unicode_to_hex(Config, U) ->
 1550:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1551:         unicode -> U;
 1552:         latin1 -> unicode_to_hex(U)
 1553:     end.
 1554: 
 1555: unicode_to_hex(U) when is_integer(U) ->
 1556:     unicode_to_hex([U]);
 1557: unicode_to_hex(Us) ->
 1558:     [if U < 128 -> U;
 1559:         U < 512 -> ["\\",integer_to_list(U,8)];
 1560:         true -> ["\\x{",integer_to_list(U,16),"}"]
 1561:      end || U <- Us].
 1562: 
 1563: width(C, Str) ->
 1564:     case ?config(encoding, C) of
 1565:         unicode -> width(Str);
 1566:         latin1 -> width(unicode_to_octet(Str))
 1567:     end.
 1568: width(Str) ->
 1569:     lists:sum(
 1570:       [npwcwidth(CP) || CP <- lists:flatten(Str)]).
 1571: 
 1572: npwcwidth(CP) ->
 1573:     try prim_tty:npwcwidth(CP)
 1574:     catch error:undef ->
 1575:             if CP =:= 16#D55C ->
 1576:                     2; %% 
 1577:                CP =:= 16#1f91A ->
 1578:                     2; %% hand
 1579:                CP =:= 16#1F3Fc ->
 1580:                     2; %% Skintone
 1581:                CP =:= 16#1f600 ->
 1582:                     2; %% smilie
 1583:                true ->
 1584:                     case lists:member(CP, [775,776,780,785,786,787,788,791,793,794,
 1585:                                            804,813,848,852,854,858,871,875,878]) of
 1586:                         true ->
 1587:                             0;
 1588:                         false ->
 1589:                             1
 1590:                     end
 1591:             end
 1592:     end.
 1593: 
 1594: tmux([Cmd|_] = Command) when is_list(Cmd) ->
 1595:     tmux(lists:concat(Command));
 1596: tmux(Command) ->
 1597:     string:trim(os:cmd(["tmux ",Command])).
 1598: 
 1599: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, Fun) ->
 1600:     erpc:call(N, Fun).
 1601: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, M, F, A) ->
 1602:     erpc:call(N, M, F, A).
 1603: 
 1604: %% Setup a TTY, but do not type anything in terminal
 1605: setup_tty(Config) ->
 1606:     Name = maps:get(name,proplists:get_value(peer, Config, #{}),
 1607:                     peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path, Config))),
 1608: 
 1609:     Envs = lists:flatmap(fun({Key,Value}) ->
 1610:                                  ["-env",Key,Value]
 1611:                          end, proplists:get_value(env,Config,[])),
 1612: 
 1613:     ExtraArgs = proplists:get_value(args,Config,[]),
 1614: 
 1615:     ExecArgs = case os:getenv("TMUX_DEBUG") of
 1616:                    "strace" ->
 1617:                        STraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1618:                                                  Name++".strace"),
 1619:                        ct:log("Link to strace: file://~ts", [STraceLog]),
 1620:                        [os:find_executable("strace"),"-f",
 1621:                         "-o",STraceLog,
 1622:                         "-e","trace=all",
 1623:                         "-e","read=0,1,2",
 1624:                         "-e","write=0,1,2"
 1625:                        ] ++ string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all);
 1626:                    "rr" ->
 1627:                        [os:find_executable("cerl"),"-rr"];
 1628:                    _ ->
 1629:                        string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all)
 1630:                end,
 1631:     DefaultPeerArgs = #{ name => Name,
 1632:                          exec =>
 1633:                              {os:find_executable("tmux"),
 1634:                               ["new-window","-n",Name,"-d","--"] ++ ExecArgs },
 1635: 
 1636:                          args => ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1637:                                   "-connect_all","false",
 1638: %                                  "-kernel","logger_level","all",
 1639:                                   "-kernel","shell_history","disabled",
 1640:                                   "-kernel","prevent_overlapping_partitions","false",
 1641:                                   "-eval","shell:prompt_func({interactive_shell_SUITE,prompt})."
 1642:                                  ] ++ Envs ++ ExtraArgs,
 1643:                          detached => false
 1644:                        },
 1645: 
 1646:     {ok, Peer, Node} =
 1647:         ?CT_PEER(maps:merge(proplists:get_value(peer,Config,#{}),
 1648:                             DefaultPeerArgs)),
 1649: 
 1650:     Self = self(),
 1651: 
 1652:     %% By default peer links with the starter. For these TCs we however only
 1653:     %% want the peer to die if we die, so we create a "unidirection link" using
 1654:     %% monitors.
 1655:     spawn(fun() ->
 1656:                   TCRef = erlang:monitor(process, Self),
 1657:                   PeerRef = erlang:monitor(process, Peer),
 1658:                   receive
 1659:                       {'DOWN',TCRef,_,_,Reason} ->
 1660:                           exit(Peer, Reason);
 1661:                       {'DOWN',PeerRef,_,_,_} ->
 1662:                           ok
 1663:                   end
 1664:           end),
 1665:     unlink(Peer),
 1666: 
 1667:     "" = tmux(["set-option -t ",Name," remain-on-exit on"]),
 1668: 
 1669:     %% We start tracing on the remote node in order to help debugging
 1670:     TraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),Name++".trace"),
 1671:     ct:log("Link to trace: file://~ts",[TraceLog]),
 1672: 
 1673:     spawn(Node,
 1674:           fun() ->
 1675:                   {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(file,TraceLog),
 1676:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv),[c,m]),
 1677:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_writer),[c,m]),
 1678:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_reader),[c,m]),
 1679:                   %% dbg:tp(user_drv,x),
 1680:                   %% dbg:tp(prim_tty,x),
 1681:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,write_nif,x),
 1682:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,read_nif,x),
 1683:                   monitor(process, Self),
 1684:                   receive _ -> ok end
 1685:           end),
 1686: 
 1687:     #tmux{ peer = Peer, node = Node, name = Name }.
 1688: 
 1689: %% Start a tty, setup custom prompt and set cursor at bottom
 1690: start_tty(Config) ->
 1691: 
 1692:     Term = setup_tty(Config),
 1693: 
 1694:     Prompt = fun() -> ["\e[94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e[0m"] end,
 1695:     erpc:call(Term#tmux.node, application, set_env,
 1696:               [stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1697:                proplists:get_value(shell_prompt_func_test, Config, Prompt)]),
 1698: 
 1699:     {Rows, _} = get_window_size(Term),
 1700: 
 1701:     %% We send a lot of newlines here in order for the number of rows
 1702:     %% in the window to be max so that we can predict what the cursor
 1703:     %% position is.
 1704:     [send_tty(Term,"\n") || _ <- lists:seq(1, Rows)],
 1705: 
 1706:     %% We enter an 'a' here so that we can get the correct orig position
 1707:     %% with an alternative prompt.
 1708:     send_tty(Term,"a.\n"),
 1709:     check_content(Term,"2>$"),
 1710:     OrigLocation = get_location(Term),
 1711:     Term#tmux{ orig_location = OrigLocation }.
 1712: 
 1713: prompt(L) ->
 1714:     N = proplists:get_value(history, L, 0),
 1715:     Fun = application:get_env(stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1716:                               fun() -> atom_to_list(node()) end),
 1717:     io_lib:format("(~ts)~w> ",[Fun(),N]).
 1718: 
 1719: stop_tty(Term) ->
 1720:     catch peer:stop(Term#tmux.peer),
 1721:     ct:log("~ts",[get_content(Term, "-e")]),
 1722: %    "" = tmux("kill-window -t " ++ Term#tmux.name),
 1723:     ok.
 1724: 
 1725: tty_name(Term) ->
 1726:     Term#tmux.name.
 1727: 
 1728: send_tty(Term, "Home") ->
 1729:     %% https://stackoverflow.com/a/55616731
 1730:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1731:     send_tty(Term,"OH");
 1732: send_tty(Term, "End") ->
 1733:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1734:     send_tty(Term,"OF");
 1735: send_tty(#tmux{ name = Name } = _Term,Value) ->
 1736:     [Head | Quotes] = string:split(Value, "'", all),
 1737:     "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ Head ++ "'"),
 1738:     [begin
 1739:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " \"'\""),
 1740:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ V ++ "'")
 1741:      end || V <- Quotes].
 1742: 
 1743: %% We use send_stdin for testing of things that we cannot sent via
 1744: %% the tmux send command, such as invalid unicode
 1745: send_stdin(Term, Chars) when is_binary(Chars) ->
 1746:     rpc(Term,erlang,display_string,[stdin,Chars]);
 1747: send_stdin(Term, Chars) ->
 1748:     send_stdin(Term, iolist_to_binary(unicode:characters_to_binary(Chars))).
 1749: 
 1750: check_location(Term, Where) ->
 1751:     check_location(Term, Where, 5).
 1752: check_location(#tmux{ orig_location = {OrigRow, OrigCol} = Orig } = Term,
 1753:                {AdjRow, AdjCol} = Where, Attempt) ->
 1754:     NewLocation = get_location(Term),
 1755:     case {OrigRow+AdjRow,OrigCol+AdjCol} of
 1756:         NewLocation -> NewLocation;
 1757:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1758:             {NewRow, NewCol} = NewLocation,
 1759:             ct:fail({wrong_location, {expected,{AdjRow, AdjCol}},
 1760:                      {got,{NewRow - OrigRow, NewCol - OrigCol},
 1761:                       {NewLocation, Orig}}});
 1762:         _ ->
 1763:             timer:sleep(50),
 1764:             check_location(Term, Where, Attempt -1)
 1765:     end.
 1766: 
 1767: get_location(Term) ->
 1768:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{cursor_y} #{cursor_x}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 1769:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 1770:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1771: 
 1772: get_window_size(Term) ->
 1773:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{window_height} #{window_width}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 1774:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 1775:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1776: 
 1777: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch) ->
 1778:     check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, #{}, 5).
 1779: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1780:     Opts = #{},
 1781:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1782:         #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1783:         Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1784:     end,
 1785:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1786:                 {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1787:                     re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1788:                 error ->
 1789:                     OrigContent
 1790:                 end,
 1791:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(NegativeMatch), [unicode]) of
 1792:         {match,_} ->
 1793:             io:format("Failed, found '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1794:             [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1795:             io:format("Failed, found '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1796:                         [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1797:             ct:fail(match);
 1798:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1799:             ok;
 1800:         _ ->
 1801:             timer:sleep(500),
 1802:             check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 1803:     end.
 1804: check_content(Term, Match) ->
 1805:     check_content(Term, Match, #{}).
 1806: check_content(Term, Match, Opts) when is_map(Opts) ->
 1807:     check_content(Term, Match, Opts, 5).
 1808: check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1809:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1810:                   #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1811:                   Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1812:               end,
 1813:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1814:                   {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1815:                       re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1816:                   error ->
 1817:                       OrigContent
 1818:               end,
 1819:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(Match), [unicode]) of
 1820:         {match,_} ->
 1821:             ok;
 1822:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1823:             io:format("Failed to find '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1824:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1825:             io:format("Failed to find '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1826:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1827:             ct:fail(nomatch);
 1828:         _ ->
 1829:             timer:sleep(500),
 1830:             check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 1831:     end.
 1832: 
 1833: get_content(Term) ->
 1834:     get_content(Term, "").
 1835: get_content(#tmux{ name = Name }, Args) ->
 1836:     Content = unicode:characters_to_binary(tmux("capture-pane -p " ++ Args ++ " -t " ++ Name)),
 1837:     case string:split(Content,"a.\na") of
 1838:         [_Ignore,C] ->
 1839:             C;
 1840:         [C] ->
 1841:             C
 1842:     end.
 1843: 
 1844: %% Tests that exit of initial shell restarts shell.
 1845: exit_initial(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1846:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 1847: 	old ->
 1848:             test_exit_initial(old);
 1849:         new ->
 1850:             test_exit_initial(old),
 1851:             test_exit_initial(new)
 1852:     end,
 1853:     ok.
 1854: 
 1855: test_exit_initial(old) ->
 1856:     rtnode:run(
 1857:       [{putline, ""},
 1858:        {putline, "2."},
 1859:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
 1860:        {putline, "exit()."},
 1861:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 1862:        {putline, ""},
 1863:        {putline, "35."},
 1864:        {expect, "35\r\n"}],
 1865:       [], [], ["-oldshell"]);
 1866: test_exit_initial(new) ->
 1867:     rtnode:run(
 1868:       [{putline, ""},
 1869:        {expect, "1> $"},
 1870:        {putline, "2."},
 1871:        {expect, "2"},
 1872:        {putline,"exit()."},
 1873:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 1874:        {expect, "1> $"},
 1875:        {putline, "35."},
 1876:        {expect, "35\r\n"}]).
 1877: 
 1878: stop_during_init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1879:     {RunErl,_ToErl,[Erl|ErlArgs]} = rtnode:get_progs(),
 1880:     case rtnode:create_tempdir() of
 1881:         {error, Reason} ->
 1882:             {skip, Reason};
 1883:         Tempdir ->
 1884:             XArg = " -kernel shell_history enabled -s init stop",
 1885:             rtnode:start_runerl_command(RunErl, Tempdir, "\\\""++Erl++"\\\""++ErlArgs++XArg),
 1886:             Logs = rtnode:read_logs(Tempdir),
 1887:             rtnode:dump_logs(Logs),
 1888:             nomatch = binary:match(map_get("erlang.log.1", Logs),
 1889:                                    <<"*** ERROR: Shell process terminated! ***">>),
 1890:             ok
 1891:     end.
 1892: 
 1893: %% This testcase tests that the correct wrapping characters are added
 1894: %% When a terminal has the xn flag set, it means that wrapping may not
 1895: %% work as expected and historically the ttysl driver has always inserted
 1896: %% a " \b" (i.e. space + backspace) when an output string ends on that line
 1897: %% in order for the cursor to be at col 0 on the next line instead of col max
 1898: %% on the current line.
 1899: %%
 1900: %% This caused problems when a string was `columns` long and then ended in "\r\n"
 1901: %% as it would first wrap due to " \b" and then output "\r\n" that cause a double
 1902: %% newline to happen.
 1903: %%
 1904: %% This testcase tests that we get a " \b" when we should and we get a "\r\n" when
 1905: %% we should.
 1906: wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1907:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 1908:         new ->
 1909:             As = lists:duplicate(20,"a"),
 1910:             rtnode:run(
 1911:               [{putline, "io:columns()."},
 1912:                {expect, "{ok,20}\r\n"},
 1913:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 1914:                {expect, As ++ " \b"},
 1915:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s~n~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\"),lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 1916:                {expect, As ++ "\r\n" ++ As ++ " \b"}
 1917:               ],
 1918:               [],
 1919:               "stty rows 40; stty columns 20; ");
 1920:         _ ->
 1921:             ok
 1922:     end,
 1923:     ok.
 1924: 
 1925: %% This testcase tests that shell_history works as it should.
 1926: %% We use Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p] in order to navigate up
 1927: %% We use Ctrl + N = Cp=[$\^n] in order to navigate down
 1928: %% We use Ctrl + B = Cp=[$\^b] in order to navigate left
 1929: %% in the console. We also need to sleep for a while in order
 1930: %% for the system to update the display before we enter more
 1931: %% commands.
 1932: shell_history(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1933:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "basic"),
 1934:     rtnode:run(
 1935:       [{putline, "echo1."},
 1936:        {expect, "echo1\r\n"},
 1937:        {putline, "echo2."},
 1938:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"},
 1939:        {putline, "echo3."},
 1940:        {expect, "echo3\r\n"},
 1941:        {putline, "echo4."},
 1942:        {expect, "echo4\r\n"},
 1943:        {putline, "echo5."},
 1944:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"}
 1945:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 1946:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1947:     rtnode:run(
 1948:       [{sleep,100},
 1949:        {putline, ""},
 1950:        %% the init:stop that stopped the node is dropped
 1951:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 1952:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 1953:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"},
 1954:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 1955:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 1956:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 1957:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 1958:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 1959:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 1960:        {putdata, [$\^b]}, {sleep,50}, %% the echo4. (cursor moved one left)
 1961:        {putline, ["ECHO"]},
 1962:        {expect, "echo4ECHO\r\n"}
 1963:       ], [], [],
 1964:       mk_history_param(Path)),
 1965:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1966: 
 1967:     %% ignore input given after io:get_line, and after h(module) pager
 1968:     rtnode:run(
 1969:        [{putdata, "io:get_line(\"getline>\").\n"},
 1970:         {expect, "getline>"},
 1971:         {putline, "hej"}, {expect, "hej\r\n"},
 1972:         {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "\\Qio:get_line(\"getline>\")\\E[.]$"}
 1973:        ], [], [],
 1974:        mk_history_param(Path)),
 1975:     ok.
 1976: 
 1977: shell_history_resize(Config) ->
 1978:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "resize"),
 1979:     rtnode:run(
 1980:       [{putline, "echo."},
 1981:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 1982:        {putline, "echo2."},
 1983:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 1984:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","123456"] ++
 1985:           mk_history_param(Path)),
 1986: 
 1987:     {ok, Logs} =
 1988:         rtnode:run(
 1989:           [{sleep,100},
 1990:            {putline, ""},
 1991:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$$"},
 1992:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 1993:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 1994:            {expect, "echo"}
 1995:           ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","654321"] ++
 1996:               mk_history_param(Path)),
 1997: 
 1998:     rtnode:check_logs(
 1999:       "erlang.log.1",
 2000:       "The configured log history file size is different from the size "
 2001:       "of the log file on disk", Logs),
 2002: 
 2003:     ok.
 2004: 
 2005: shell_history_eaccess(Config) ->
 2006:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "eaccess"),
 2007:     file:make_dir(filename:dirname(Path)),
 2008:     ok = file:make_dir(Path),
 2009:     {ok, Info} = file:read_file_info(Path),
 2010:     try
 2011:         NoExecMode = Info#file_info.mode band (bnot 8#111),
 2012:         file:write_file_info(Path,Info#file_info{ mode = NoExecMode }),
 2013: 
 2014:         %% Cannot create history log in folder
 2015:         {ok, Logs1} =
 2016:             rtnode:run(
 2017:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2018:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2019:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2020: 
 2021:         ct:log("~p",[Logs1]),
 2022:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs1),
 2023: 
 2024:         %% shell_docs recursively creates the folder to store the
 2025:         %% logs. This test checks that erlang still starts if we
 2026:         %% cannot create the folders to the path.
 2027:         {ok, Logs2} =
 2028:             rtnode:run(
 2029:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2030:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2031:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(filename:join(Path,"logs"))),
 2032: 
 2033:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs2)
 2034: 
 2035:     after
 2036:         file:write_file_info(Path, Info)
 2037:     end,
 2038:     ok.
 2039: 
 2040: shell_history_repair(Config) ->
 2041:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair"),
 2042: 
 2043:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2044:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2045: 
 2046:     {ok, Logs} =
 2047:         rtnode:run(
 2048:           [{putline, ""},
 2049:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2050:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2051:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2052:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2053: 
 2054:     %% The regexp below checks that he string is NOT part of the log
 2055:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2056:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired",
 2057:                       false,
 2058:                       Logs),
 2059:     ok.
 2060: 
 2061: shell_history_repair_corrupt(Config) ->
 2062:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair_corrupt"),
 2063: 
 2064:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2065:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2066: 
 2067:     %% We corrupt the disklog
 2068:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read,append]),
 2069:     ok = file:write(D, [10,10]),
 2070:     ok = file:close(D),
 2071: 
 2072:     {ok, Logs} =
 2073:         rtnode:run(
 2074:           [{putline, ""},
 2075:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2076:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2077:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2078:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2079: 
 2080:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2081:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired.",
 2082:                       Logs),
 2083:     ok.
 2084: 
 2085: shell_history_corrupt(Config) ->
 2086:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "corrupt"),
 2087: 
 2088:     %% We initialize the shell history log with a known value.
 2089:     rtnode:run(
 2090:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2091:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2092:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2093:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2094:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2095: 
 2096:     %% We corrupt the disklog.
 2097:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read, append]),
 2098:     ok = file:write(D, [10, 10]),
 2099:     ok = file:close(D),
 2100: 
 2101:     {ok, Logs} =
 2102:         rtnode:run(
 2103:           [{putline, ""},
 2104:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2105:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2106:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2107:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2108:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2109: 
 2110:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Invalid chunk in the file", Logs),
 2111:     ok.
 2112: 
 2113: %% Stop the node without closing the log.
 2114: shell_history_halt(Path) ->
 2115:     try
 2116:         rtnode:run(
 2117:           [{putline, "echo."},
 2118:            {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2119:            {sleep, 2500}, % disk_log internal cache timer is 2000 ms
 2120:            {putline, "halt(0)."},
 2121:            {expect, "\r\n"},
 2122:            {sleep, 1000} %% wait for node to terminate
 2123:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path))
 2124:     catch
 2125:         _:_ ->
 2126:             ok
 2127:     end.
 2128: 
 2129: shell_history_path(Config, TestCase) ->
 2130:     filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2131:                    "shell_history", TestCase]).
 2132: 
 2133: mk_history_param(Path) ->
 2134:     ["-kernel","shell_history","enabled",
 2135:      "-kernel","shell_history_path","\"" ++ Path ++ "\"",
 2136:      "-kernel","shell_history_drop","[\"init:stop().\"]"
 2137:     ].
 2138: 
 2139: shell_history_custom(_Config) ->
 2140:     %% Up key: Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p]
 2141:     rtnode:run(
 2142:       [{expect, "1> $"},
 2143:        %% {putline, ""},
 2144:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "0[.]"},
 2145:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2146:        {expect, "0\r\n"},
 2147:        {putline, "echo."},
 2148:        {expect, "!echo\r\n"} % exclamation mark is printed by custom history module
 2149:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2150:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2151:     ok.
 2152: 
 2153: shell_history_custom_errors(_Config) ->
 2154: 
 2155:     %% Check that we can start with a node with an undefined
 2156:     %% provider module.
 2157:     rtnode:run(
 2158:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2159:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2160:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history","very_broken",
 2161:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2162: 
 2163:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2164:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2165:     rtnode:run(
 2166:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2167:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2168:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2169:                   "-kernel","provider_load","crash",
 2170:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2171: 
 2172:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2173:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2174:     rtnode:run(
 2175:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2176:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2177:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2178:                   "-kernel","provider_load","badreturn",
 2179:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2180: 
 2181:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2182:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2183:     rtnode:run(
 2184:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2185:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"},
 2186:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"}
 2187:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2188:                   "-kernel","provider_add","crash",
 2189:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2190: 
 2191:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2192:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2193:     rtnode:run(
 2194:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2195:        {expect, "It returned {error,badreturn}.\r\n"},
 2196:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2197:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2198:                   "-kernel","provider_add","badreturn",
 2199:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2200: 
 2201:     ok.
 2202: 
 2203: load() ->
 2204:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_load) of
 2205:         {ok, crash} ->
 2206:             error(crash);
 2207:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2208:             %% Should return a list of string()
 2209:             ok;
 2210:         _ ->
 2211:             ["0.\n\n"]
 2212:     end.
 2213: 
 2214: add(_Line) ->
 2215:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_add) of
 2216:         {ok, crash} ->
 2217:             error(crash);
 2218:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2219:             %% Should return ok
 2220:             {error, badreturn};
 2221:         _ ->
 2222:             io:format("!", [])
 2223:     end.
 2224: 
 2225: %% Tests that local shell can be started by means of job control.
 2226: job_control_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2227:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2228: 	old ->
 2229: 	    %% Old shell tests
 2230: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2231: 	new ->
 2232: 	    %% New shell tests
 2233: 	    rtnode:run(
 2234:               [{putline, ""},
 2235:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2236:                {putline, "2."},
 2237:                {expect,  "\r\n2\r\n"},
 2238:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2239:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2240:                {putline, "s"},
 2241:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2242:                {putline, "c"},
 2243:                {expect,  "\r\nEshell"},
 2244:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2245:                {putline, "35."},
 2246:                {expect,  "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2247:                {expect,  "2> $"},
 2248:                {putline, "receive M -> M end.\r\n"},
 2249:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2250:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2251:                {putline, "i 3"},
 2252:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2253:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2254:                {putline, "i 2"},
 2255:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2256:                {putline, "c"},
 2257:                {expect,  "[*][*] exception exit: killed"},
 2258:                {expect,  "[23]>"},
 2259:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2260:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2261:                {putline, "k 3"},
 2262:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2263:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2264:                {putline, "k 2"},
 2265:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2266:                {putline, "k"},
 2267:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2268:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2269:                {putline, "c"},
 2270:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2271:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2272:                {putline, "i"},
 2273:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2274:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2275:                {putline, "?"},
 2276:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2277:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2278:                {putline, "h"},
 2279:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2280:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2281:                {putdata, "\t"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2282:                {sleep, 100},
 2283:                {putline, ""},
 2284:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2285:                {putdata, "\^r"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2286:                {sleep, 100},
 2287:                {putline, ""},
 2288:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2289:                {putline, "c 1"},
 2290:                {expect, "\r\n"},
 2291:                {putline, "35."},
 2292:                {expect, "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2293:                {expect, "[23]> $"}
 2294:               ]),
 2295:             ok
 2296:     end.
 2297: 
 2298: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control.
 2299: job_control_remote(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2300:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2301: 	old ->
 2302: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2303: 	_ ->
 2304:             {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => ["-connect_all","false"],
 2305:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2306:             try
 2307:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2308:             after
 2309:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2310:             end
 2311:     end.
 2312: 
 2313: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control to
 2314: %% -noshell node.
 2315: job_control_remote_noshell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2316:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2317: 	old ->
 2318: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2319: 	_ ->
 2320: 	    {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ name => peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2321:                                              args => ["-connect_all","false","-noshell"],
 2322:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2323:             try
 2324:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2325:             after
 2326:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2327:             end
 2328:     end.
 2329: 
 2330: test_remote_job_control(Node) ->
 2331:     RemNode = peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2332:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() ->
 2333:                                    receive die ->
 2334:                                            ok
 2335:                                    end
 2336:                            end),
 2337:     PidStr = erpc:call(Node, erlang, pid_to_list, [Pid]),
 2338:     true = erpc:call(Node, erlang, register, [kalaskula,Pid]),
 2339:     PrintedNode = printed_atom(Node),
 2340:     CookieString = printed_atom(erlang:get_cookie()),
 2341: 
 2342:     rtnode:run(
 2343:       [{putline, ""},
 2344:        {putline, "erlang:get_cookie()."},
 2345:        {expect, "\r\n\\Q" ++ CookieString ++ "\\E"},
 2346:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2347:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2348:        {putline, "r " ++ PrintedNode},
 2349:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2350:        {putline, "j"},
 2351:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2352:        {expect, "2[*] {\\Q"++PrintedNode++"\\E,shell,start,\\[]}"},
 2353:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2354:        {putline, "c"},
 2355:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2356:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2357:        {expect, "\\Q(" ++ atom_to_list(Node) ++")1> \\E$"},
 2358:        {putline, "whereis(kalaskula)."},
 2359:        {expect, PidStr},
 2360:        {putline, "kalaskula ! die."},
 2361:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2362:        {expect, "[*][*][*] Shell process terminated!"},
 2363:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2364:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2365:        {putline, "j"},
 2366:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2367:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2368:        {putline, "c"},
 2369:        {expect, "Unknown job"},
 2370:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2371:        {putline, "c 1"},
 2372:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[12]> $"},
 2373:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2374:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2375:        {putline, "j"},
 2376:        {expect, "1[*] {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2377:        {putline, "c"},
 2378:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"},
 2379:        {sleep, 100},
 2380:        {putline, "35."},
 2381:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"}
 2382:       ], RemNode),
 2383:     Pid ! die,
 2384:     ok.
 2385: 
 2386: %% Tests various control keys.
 2387: ctrl_keys(_Config) ->
 2388:     Cu = [$\^u],
 2389:     Cw = [$\^w],
 2390:     Cy = [$\^y],
 2391:     Home = [27,$O,$H],
 2392:     End = [27,$O,$F],
 2393:     rtnode:run(
 2394:       [{putline,""},
 2395:        {putline,"2."},
 2396:        {expect,"2"},
 2397:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cw++"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+W
 2398:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2399:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cu++"\"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+U
 2400:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2401:        {putline,"world\"."++Home++"\"hello "},	% test <HOME>
 2402:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2403:        {putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++End++"\"."},	% test <END>
 2404:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2405:        {putline,"\"hello world\""++Cu++Cy++"."},
 2406:        {expect,"\"hello world\""}] ++
 2407:           wordLeft() ++ wordRight()),
 2408:     ok.
 2409: 
 2410: wordLeft() ->
 2411:     L1 = "\e\e[D",
 2412:     L2 = "\e[5D",
 2413:     L3 = "\e[1;5D",
 2414:     wordLeft(L1) ++ wordLeft(L2) ++ wordLeft(L3).
 2415: 
 2416: wordLeft(Chars) ->
 2417:     End = "\eOF",
 2418:     [{putline,"\"world\""++Chars++"hello "++End++"."},
 2419:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2420: 
 2421: wordRight() ->
 2422:     R1 = "\e\e[C",
 2423:     R2 = "\e[5C",
 2424:     R3 = "\e[1;5C",
 2425:     wordRight(R1) ++ wordRight(R2) ++ wordRight(R3).
 2426: 
 2427: wordRight(Chars) ->
 2428:     Home = "\eOH",
 2429:     [{putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++Chars++"\"."},
 2430:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2431: 
 2432: %% Test that -remsh works
 2433: remsh_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2434:     {ok, Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2435:     TargetNodeStr = printed_atom(TargetNode),
 2436:     [_Name,Host] = string:split(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
 2437: 
 2438:     PreCmds = [{putline,""},
 2439:                {putline,"node()."},
 2440:                {expect, "\\Q" ++ TargetNodeStr ++ "\\E\r\n"}],
 2441: 
 2442:     PostCmds = quit_hosting_node(),
 2443: 
 2444:     %% Test that remsh works with explicit -sname.
 2445:     HostNode = atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "_host",
 2446:     HostNodeStr = printed_atom(list_to_atom(HostNode ++ "@" ++ Host)),
 2447:     rtnode:run(
 2448:       PreCmds ++
 2449:           [{putline,"nodes()."},
 2450:            {expect, "\\Q" ++ HostNodeStr ++ "\\E"}] ++
 2451:           PostCmds,
 2452:       HostNode, " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2453: 
 2454:     %% Test that remsh works without -sname.
 2455:     rtnode:run(PreCmds ++ PostCmds, [], " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2456: 
 2457:     %% Test that if multiple remsh are given, we select the first
 2458:     rtnode:run([{expect, "Multiple"}] ++ PreCmds ++ PostCmds,
 2459:                [], " ",
 2460:                "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr ++ " -remsh invalid_node"),
 2461: 
 2462:     peer:stop(Peer),
 2463: 
 2464:     ok.
 2465: 
 2466: %% Test that if we cannot connect to a node, we get a correct error
 2467: remsh_error(_Config) ->
 2468:     "Could not connect to \"invalid_node\"\n" =
 2469:         os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -remsh invalid_node").
 2470: 
 2471: quit_hosting_node() ->
 2472:     %% Command sequence for entering a shell on the hosting node.
 2473:     [{putdata, "\^g"},
 2474:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2475:      {putline, "s"},
 2476:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2477:      {putline, "c"},
 2478:      {expect, ["Eshell"]},
 2479:      {expect, ["1> $"]}].
 2480: 
 2481: %% Test that -remsh works with long names.
 2482: remsh_longnames(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2483:     %% If we cannot resolve the domain, we need to add localhost to the longname
 2484:     Domain =
 2485:         case inet_db:res_option(domain) of
 2486:             [] ->
 2487:                 "@127.0.0.1";
 2488:             _ -> ""
 2489:         end,
 2490:     Name = peer:random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
 2491:     case rtnode:start(" -name " ++ Name ++ Domain) of
 2492:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2493:             try
 2494:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2495:                     rtnode:start("-name undefined" ++ Domain ++
 2496:                                      " -remsh " ++ Name),
 2497:                 try
 2498:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2499:                            SNode,
 2500:                            STPid,
 2501:                            [{putline, ""},
 2502:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2503:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2504:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2505:                            CNode,
 2506:                            CTPid,
 2507:                            [{putline, ""},
 2508:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2509:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2510:                 after
 2511:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2512:                 end
 2513:             after
 2514:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2515:             end;
 2516:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2517:             Else
 2518:     end.
 2519: 
 2520: %% Test that -remsh works without epmd.
 2521: remsh_no_epmd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2522:     EPMD_ARGS = "-start_epmd false -erl_epmd_port 12346 ",
 2523:     Name = ?CT_PEER_NAME(),
 2524:     case rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2525:                       EPMD_ARGS ++ " -sname " ++ Name) of
 2526:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2527:             try
 2528:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2529:                        SNode,
 2530:                        STPid,
 2531:                        [{putline, ""},
 2532:                         {putline, "node()."},
 2533:                         {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2534:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2535:                     rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2536:                                  EPMD_ARGS ++ " -remsh "++Name),
 2537:                 try
 2538:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2539:                            CNode,
 2540:                            CTPid,
 2541:                            [{putline, ""},
 2542:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2543:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2544:                 after
 2545:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2546:                 end
 2547:             after
 2548:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2549:             end;
 2550:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2551:             Else
 2552:     end.
 2553: remsh_expand_compatibility_25(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2554:     {ok, _Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{}), %% Create a vsn 26 node
 2555:     NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode), %% compatibility
 2556:     %% Start a node on vsn 25 but run the shell on vsn 26
 2557:     case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh "++NodeName, [{release, "25"}|Config]) of
 2558:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2559:             try
 2560:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2561:                        STPid,
 2562:                        [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2563:                         {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2564:                         quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2565:             after
 2566:                 Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2567:                 rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2568:             end;
 2569:         Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2570:     end.
 2571: remsh_expand_compatibility_later_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2572:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2573:     case ?CT_PEER_REL([], "25", PrivDir) of
 2574:         not_available -> {skip, "25 not available"};
 2575:         {ok, _Peer, TargetNode}  ->
 2576:             NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode),
 2577:             %% Start a node on later version but run the shell on vsn 25
 2578:             case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh " ++ NodeName, Config) of
 2579:                 {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2580:                     try
 2581:                         ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2582:                             STPid,
 2583:                             [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2584:                              {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2585:                              quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2586:                     after
 2587:                         Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2588:                         rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2589:                     end;
 2590:                 Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2591:             end
 2592:     end.
 2593: 
 2594: printed_atom(A) ->
 2595:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w", [A])).
